definition: ordinary/commonplace/mundane/temporal/of the material world (as opposed to supernatural or immortal levels)/every/all/whatever/altogether/gist/outline/note of Chinese musical scale

sentences.english: For everything there is a season, and a time for every matter under heaven. (
sentences.chinese: 凡事都有定期，天下万务都有定时。

sentences.english: For everything there is a season, and a time for every matter under heaven.
sentences.chinese: 凡事都有定期，天下万务皆有定时。

sentences.english: There is no end to what the children want to know; they always like to demand the how and why.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们的求知欲是无止境的，他们凡事总要寻根究底。

sentences.english: Do not take things too seriously.
Cor. 14:40 But all things must be done becomingly and in order.
sentences.chinese: 林前十四40凡事都要端正得体的按著次序行。

sentences.english: The Year of the Rooster symbolizes early starts and new beginnings.
sentences.chinese: 鸡年象征着凡事早早行动，也象征着迎来新的开端。

sentences.english: But everything in the world has two sides. Watching TV is no exception.
sentences.chinese: 但是，凡事都有利有弊，看电视也不例外。

sentences.english: We should always use our brains and think everything over carefully.
sentences.chinese: 凡事应该用脑筋好好想一想。

sentences.english: All things are subject to the law of cause and effect.
Anakin, don’t do anything without first consulting either myself or the council.
sentences.chinese: 阿纳金，凡事都要和我或者和议会商量后再决定。

sentences.english: Look for the good in everything.
Alaric: Well, then you should know just how possible this is.
sentences.chinese: 那你就应该清楚凡事皆有可能。

sentences.english: But other days, I can dance with my Muse and forget about the vacuuming.
sentences.chinese: 而其他时间，我会暂时忘却凡事，与缪斯女神共舞。

sentences.english: God says you can pray about everything.
If thou canst believe, all things are possible to him that believeth.
sentences.chinese: 你若能信，在信的人，凡事都能。

sentences.english: All things are difficult before they are easy.

definition: to work/to handle matters/to have a job
too far is as bad as not enough (idiom, from the Analects)
think again and again before acting (idiom); consider carefully in advance
think three times then go (idiom); don't act before you've thought it through carefully
to act impetuously (idiom); on an impulse
to be of service to others/to help others/benevolent
to conduct oneself/to behave with integrity
